bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to the Librarian at the Library of the Surgeon General, July 21, 1925

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to the Librarian at the Library of the Surgeon General, July 21, 1925
div1.opener:
Book
Library
The Westmoreland, Apt. 262,
2122 California St., N. W.,
, D. C.
July 21, 1925.
/LC
Librarian,
Library of the Surgeon General,
Army Medical Museum,
7th. and B. Sts. S. W.,
Washington, D. C.
Sir:
div1.p:
I would be very grateful if you could loan me the following
books; for use in the History of Yellow Fever on which I am engaged.
1: History of Yellow Fever
Augustin, George
# 203594.
2: Traite Therapeutique et Clinique
Féraud, Béranger.
#132001.
With sincere appreciation of past courtesies, I remain
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Assistant Surgeon General,
(On Waiting Orders) Address:
The Westmoreland, Apt. 262,
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
books July 24th
